discussion.content: Office.com brings to Office365 where all apps available to the user are displayed

Selected Answer: C
office.com is correct, since the SalesPerson role is not an admin role therefore it cannot access to admin.powerplatform.com

questions.question_text:
A new salesperson has user access in Microsoft 365 and salesperson privileges in Dynamics 365 Sales.

The salesperson cannot recall the Dynamics 365 Sales app URL.

You need to provide a location where the user can access the app.

Which URL should you provide?

DRAG DROP
-

You plan to use Dynamics 365 Customer Voice to gather customer feedback for three different lines of business.

You need to determine how each requirement will be fulfilled.

Which objects should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate objects to the correct requirements. Each object may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content: Why use Project instead of Report: While using separate projects offers a more comprehensive segregation at the data collection level, reports can help in analyzing and presenting insights in a customized manner.

comments.content: I think you would likely separate the data via Project, then use reports to analyze it. As the question purely states the segregation, I think the Project is correct.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
To add a case automatically to the sales or service queue based on the field value, you can use routing rules in Dynamics 365 Customer Service1. Routing rules are used to route cases to the appropriate queue based on the criteria specified in the rule. You can create a routing rule that routes cases to the sales queue if the case type field has a value of “sales,” and to the service queue if the case type field has a value of “service.”
C. Routing rule is the feature on Customer Service to distribute cases dynamically to the right queue of agents

questions.question_text:
A company allows customers to submit cases through its website. A case type field on the webform has sales and service options.

You need to add the case automatically to the sales or service queue based on the field value, using only out-of-the-box functionality.

What should you configure?

DRAG DROP
-

A company uses Dynamics 365 Customer Service. The company only uses out-of-the-box features.

A customer service manager plans to use dashboards for the management team.

You need to describe which visualization should be used for each requirement.

Which visualizations should you use? To answer, drag the appropriate visualization to the correct requirement. Each visualization may be used once, more than once, or not at all. You may need to drag the split bar between panes or scroll to view content.

NOTE: Each correct selection is worth one point.

//IMG//

discussion.content:
The first is Historical analytics. This learn page literally describes using historical analytics with ai insights (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/administer/configure-cs-historical-analytics-csh?tabs=customerserviceadmincenter)

The second is interactive experience dashboard. A big feature of interactive dashboards is using Global filters and they have an example of active cases and activities being used as such in an image example (https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-service/use/customer-service-hub-user-guide-dashboard)

Both are correct

1. AI-generated case insight is for Interactive experiences dashboard
2. Standard Dashboard is for active cases, activities etc

AI-generated case insights.

Interactive experience dashboard: The interactive experience dashboard in Dynamics 365 Customer Service is designed to provide a more dynamic and interactive way of viewing data. It can integrate AI-generated insights, which makes it a suitable choice for visualizing AI-generated case insights.
List of active cases and activities refined by using a global filter.

Standard dashboard: The standard dashboard in Dynamics 365 Customer Service is well-suited for displaying lists of records, such as active cases and activities. It allows for the application of global filters to refine the data displayed, making it an appropriate choice for this requirement.
The answer might be Yes, Yes, Yes

The audience in customer journey can be contact, lead or customer profile. Below is the URL for your reference.
https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/customer-insights/journeys/real-time-marketing-audience-data

This video, minute 2:00 shows that Audience is a Segment and it can be Contacts, Leads etc https://www.encorebusiness.com/blog/customer-journeys-in-dynamics-365-marketing/#:~:text=In%20Dynamics%20365%20Marketing%2C%20a,they%20interact%20with%20your%20company.
The answer should be Yes, Yes, Yes.

questions.answer_description:
Box 1: Yes -
All journeys start with the participants:
Select Set audience (or, alternatively, select +). The Audience properties pane will appear on the right side of the page. Leave the default settings there (for example, Segment selected as the audience source type). Select the segment that you want to target with your campaign in the segment lookup field.

Box 2: No -
Customer journeys can only target contacts, not accounts or leads, so be sure to create contact records for everyone you want to include in your customer journeys, and then associate each of them with any relevant accounts or leads.

Box 3: Yes -
Customer journey audience receive email form submitted
Reference:
https://docs.microsoft.com/en-us/dynamics365/marketing/manage-customer-information
